author: fhilip.k
title: Ideation Protocol Work Group
description: Projects working on ideation solutions are not communicating. Communication between these solutions is required.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem with which we start is that projects working on ideation solutions (generating new ideas) are not communicating. The proposal aims to undertake a series of workshops with projects working on ideation to agree on protocol level implementations. I find a very poor fit between the challenge and the proposal, although the problem identification touches slightly a correct problem, albeit vague as well. Somehow the overall level of detail is simply not sufficient for me to deem this proposal worthy. I highly suggest against voting for it.
f6_assessments.q1:
Note: this proposal is very similar to another one, therefore the feasibility assessments are also very similar in terms of language and overall assessment. 

There are very vague descriptions of “roles” to participate in the project, like for instance facilitator, organizer, treasurer, maintainers. For future iterations I highly recommend that at least the core team behind the projects comes out to light with names and even Linkedin profiles available. 

In terms of budget there are many questions to be asked and the logic behind it is not very clear. For instance, participant fees are an important part - will they be industry experts, general audience, or whom exactly? It is not clear at all. Every other budget caption is also vague and / or out of logic - i shall spare you the details here. I highly advise that future iterations make a much more clear budget, perhaps employ some outside help in order to structure the information better. 

Timewise, the project would take 6 months. In the first month we would have built the coalition of participants, drafting the process and research of participants. The next months would see the meetings taking place, closing meetings and a closing meeting. Again a very clear lack of structure in the timeline. 

Again, a very poor feasibility for this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
Note: this proposal is very similar to another one, therefore the auditability assessments are also very similar in terms of language and overall assessment. 

The proposed solution is to organize 6 meetings to be held, but it is not very clear between whom, and at the end the meetings a protocol would emerge, but it is not clear for what purpose other than “authentication”. The overall vagueness leaves a lot to be desired and there is no clear way to link the proposal to the challenge. I propose that future iterations specify more clearly at least the target audience of the meetings and what outcomes they would have.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem of lack of communication in ideation of solutions, is clearly stated, and this problem is one that prevents common standards as well as interoperability. The solution will allow for a Cardano open standards protocol to be developed which allows for communication, collaboration and more successful implementation. This both furthers the Cardano mission, and supports the community in a positive way. The KPIs are aligned with both the proposal and the challenges, however these are quite general in nature- eg 'build coalition of participants' and hold 'summit meetings'. More specificity around numbers and meetings would have helped with a higher rating.
f6_assessments.q1:
The lead on the team is immersed in the Cardano community having participated in the catalyst process since fund 3, having successfully funded and implemented projects, being a participating member of the Community Governance Oversight working group, and the Creator and lead of Cardano AIM. The other team roles are specified even if team members are not. 
There is clear budget and this is broken down, by role, with information on what each of the roles would be responsible for. The timeframe of 6 months seems reasonable to allow for engagement and the proposal of a protocol. Risks around participation were identified, but no mitigation was offered.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones are broken down into month 1, and then month 2-6 with a general overview. While the objective is clear, this lack of information on the specifics in each of the months will make it difficult to audit, however the provision of meeting minutes is included as an outcome with options for feedback so this will allow for a level of transparency and engagement with the community.

f6_assessments.q0:
For success of any projects communication plays vital role, As Ideation is the creative process of generating new ideas, which can be accomplished through a variety of ideation techniques,
As projects working on ideation solutions don't communicative much as it dealt with extensive experience delivering technical services and application development in multiple environments from blockchain to everything,
As proposer wants to solve this by undertaking many series of summits with projects working on ideation to agree on protocol level implementations,
As by providing communication it will help to solve the issues they will be facing technically ,
This proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
As proposer is active participant  in the catalyst process since fund 3. Successfully funded and implemented projects. and Participating member of the Community Governance Oversight working group. Creator and lead of Cardano AIM. Has lots of enough experience for the above project.... As there are many projects and funding working on  ideation solutions for the Cardano ecosystem, As it is good for decentralization and different implementations, As with many cases we can work on interoperability between the projects,
As protocol is yet to be established I hope it will help ensure vendor-neutral implementations of Authentication platforms.
As there will risk of leaking ideas from working on groups ,
whole idea and project depends on there standard working protocols,
But working together and sharing ideas and goals will make projects completed faster, efficient and innovative,

Given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The detailed budget plan given by proposer 
allocating budget for 6 meeting  Facilitation, formations, participant fees, administration, maintaining and  platform costs are reasonable, 
As team includes Facilitator, organizer, admin department, Maintainer etc all,
As budget plan and team details is great..

As for auditing  proposer will be providing recordings of 6 meetings conducted,  
And even number of participants should be given,
As implementation of the open  protocol will be encouraged amongst future authentication platform developers,

 The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Many projects get failed as there is lack of communication , some standards must be maintained for ideation process and its presentation, as there is no proper standards set for ideation in cardano community.
This will definitely help to maintain standards for ideation process , some of the newly developed ideas would have developed weak models on presented ideas , models like these can be educated for improving their idea whether it can be done by sketching or modelling or presenting which helps for new developers for improving ,hence this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Since all the work groups has to accept the standards set by proposer's team , it will be difficult to convenience every one, the only solution to such issue is by conducting most of the surveys and understanding the values given by each Work group. The proposers has been completing the project since fund 3 which shows great track record towards the project , as proposer by now would have gained lot of experience working with project like these, hence with experienced gained plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposal would have been more complete if the proposer would have introduced himself completely and could have introduced the team with whom he had worked previously. The timeline provided in proposal too simple other than that it has shown clear budget breakdown , it also contains good key indicators. With excellent idea towards the encouraging new ideas towards  block chain  and keeping all the ideation people under same umbrella the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Although almost identical* with the Authentication Protocol Work Group proposal (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/399380) this is the weaker of the two. Let me explain why. The challenge asks us to "build an open ecosystem to drive growth, give equal opportunities to all, and increase the synergies across Cardano projects". On the outset this incentivized approach is a nice way of guaranteeing participation and the plan is well thought out. When it comes to ideation use case, however, I disagree that there even is much of an issue here. If there is, it should have been brought up more clealry. There are plenty of ideas out there, only execution matters. And there are different ways to do ideation, whether they are interoperable or not, doesn't matter. Different people prefer different approaches.

(*Dear VCAs and similarity-assessing bots, I have utilized some of the same wordings in both of my assessments because the proposals really are almost identical).
f6_assessments.q1: If this gets funding, it's 100% clear that Philip will deliver what he has promised. He is an upstanding community member without whom the Catalyst process would have been more cumbersome and less effective. He has built AIM tools that we all use and he has participated in improvement and documentation of the process itself. As for the feasibility of the proposal itself, there would have to be further justification as to why it's needed, what these different ideation approaches are and what kind of interoperability is needed among them.
f6_assessments.q2: Apart from what has been stated above regarding the need for more clarity, and the fact that the measures could be better, there are no other obvious flaws in the proposal. The deliverables, timeline and KPIs make sense. Auditability has been well outlined.  Maybe it would have been good to have the maintainers, treasurer, administrator, organizer and facilitator named. Now we can just assume that as sole proposer it's Philip who wears all those hats.

f6_assessments.q0: The "Ideation Protocol Work Group" proposal aims to enhance corporation between projects in the ideation stage. While the intention of this project seems to be in tandem with the objective of the challenge. Setting up work group on ideation protocol could be difficult in actual implementation and unrealistic with the duration of funding cycle. It is unlikely that the summit itself will yield result by the time of next proposal submission. The impact of this proposal is also not scalable to achieve the desired result. Besides it is not a one solution fits all (the authentication systems in different projects will likely have distinctive characteristics and not being able to be understood by every participants coupled with the time constraint as mentioned earlier). Also the proposer has not elaborated what he means by "open engagement" which is the core solution of his proposition.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal timeline is around 6 months (6 meetings for 2-3 hours) are unrealistic to onboard all proposers in various projects (both funded and not funded projects) to the summit. There are quite a few questionable items ie. formation & participants fees. The proposer has not elaborated what those fees are. It is quite unlikely one will give away time and be charged to attend the summits. There is no list of team members making this challenging project a solo effort which would make the project a struggle as the proposal lists many different functions to make a project feasible ie. facilitator, organiser, administrator, treasurer, maintainers etc. Until the project can disclose this behind-the-scene working group, it is very unlikely that various teams will commit their time and resources to participate in the summits. The proposal is also in contrary to the decentralisation goal of Cardano where projects should be allowed to be creative and not suppressed by this protocol work group.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal should elaborate more on "future authentication platform". Suppose that the draft protocol is the final output aimed by this proposal, what would be the outcome if it is not agreeable by the proposers. Would this discourage proposers in coming up with new ideas but instead being perceived as dissents by the work group. Although the project comes with the good intention of fostering the collaboration, the plan needs to be well thought out for the undesirable side impact. The project needs to define more on several terms and be more transparent in its goal and the team behind the work group. The Ideation Protocol Work Group solution is not fitting with the challenge brief and could potentially yield the opposite result.

solution: Undertake a series of summits with projects working on ideation to agree on protocol level implementations.
experience: Participation in the catalyst process since fund 3. Successfully funded and implemented projects. Participating member of the Community Governance Oversight working group. Creator and lead of Cardano AIM.
